Just want to say thanks for always uploading great quality shows.  I do prefer AVI files as I always transfer to flash drive to watch on my TV but it doesn't recognise MP4's.

@123bou & the "I prefer.avi crowd"

First of all, neither .avi nor .mp4 are file-formats. They're Video-Containers that can include a whole pandemonium of codecs/filetypes (DivX, mpeg2, mpeg4 and many more). 
Thus it can help (in some cases) to just rename a .mp4 (if your device eg TV doesnt know what to do with an .mp4) to .avi to make it playable.

Second -123bou you say that you only have a crappy laptop. Even if its really crappy and 10 years old it should be no problem to hook it up to your TV via VGA or S-Video and run VLC on it.
Otherwise a used PC with onboard HD-Graphics, HDMI and 7.1 Sound can be purchased
for a lousy 75$ these days. Add a 20$ wireless Keyboard/Mouse to that and you have a full Media rig hooked up to your TV.

Third, the h.264 codec (or in this case the x.264 container) is the future, for it alows much higher bitrates and higher quality pictures at th same filesize of an .avi, it supports HD-Profiles and supports multicore processor use. Plus the x264 is under Gnu Public license, which makes it free to use.
AVI was implemented in fucking 1992, in fucking Windows 3.1 people,
your bitching about your devices not playing it is the equivalent of somebody bitching that his VHS is not playing BLuRay.
by "it" I of course refer to x.264.
